title: Func. def. by int.m semicircle and segments part - d

content.description: Let f be the continuous function defined on [-4, 3] whose graph, consisting of three line segments and a semicircle centered at the origin, is given above. Let g be the function given by <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </mrow> </mstyle></mrow> </math> .
content.question: For -4<x<3, find all values of x for which the graph of g has a point of inflection. Explain your reasoning.

frqParts.text: For -4<x<3, find all values of x for which the graph of g has a point of inflection. Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
